statement.p: Convert 75 miles per hour to feet per second. You may wish to use this conversion table.
75 miles per hour = feet per second. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.

solution.p: To convert to feet per second we need to convert miles to feet and hours to seconds. There are 5280 ft per mile, 60 minutes per hour, and 60 seconds per minute. Note this means there are \displaystyle\frac{{{60}\ \text{ min}}}{{{1}\ \text{ hr}}}\cdot\frac{{{60}\ \text{ sec}}}{{{1}\ \text{ min}}}=\frac{{{3600}\ \text{ sec}}}{{{1}\ \text{ hr}}}. The same relationship can be written \displaystyle{\left({1}\ \text{ hr}\right)}{\left({3600}\ \text{ sec}\right)}.

Thus there are \displaystyle{75}\frac{{\text{mi}}}{{\text{hr}}}\cdot\frac{{{5280}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{1}\ \text{ mi}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ \text{ hr}}}{{{3600}\ \text{ sec}}}={110}\frac{{\text{ft}}}{{\text{sec}}}
